summary: This is an email chain from August 12, 2019, between individuals with email addresses associated with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), scheduling a meeting to discuss next steps in the Epstein case. The document shows coordination among prosecutors shortly after Epstein's arrest.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting on Epstein Case
events.description: A meeting is scheduled to discuss next steps in the Epstein case, proposed for either before 11 AM or after 2 PM.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 12, 2019, which is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019.
The correspondence involves email addresses associated with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), indicating it is internal prosecution team communication.
The subject is scheduling a meeting to discuss 'next steps in the Epstein case,' showing active case management by prosecutors.
All personal names in the 'To', 'From', and 'Cc' fields are redacted or represented by placeholders, so no individuals can be identified.
